result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R Petrie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in as to cases 15cm2059 and 15cm1829.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
On motion of the State, Court ordered bail set in the amount of $100.00 cash with TOT to Justice Point for monitoring.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties in receipt of doctor's report indicating defendant is now competent to proceed.   All parties stipulate to the findings. Court orders proceedings reinstated.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report from WCS dated 09/14/2015 regarding the defendant's transportation status received and filed.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 9 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Court ordered involuntary medication for the defendant.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 9 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-24-15  at 8:30 a.m. for review hearing  in Branch 47.  Review hearing scheduled for 11-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received and filed. lr

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 All parties in receipt of doctor's report that is inconclusive , defendant was uncooperative .  Court ordered defendant to be transported by the Sheriff's dept.  to Mendota for inpatient evaluation.  Defendant continues  to be remanded.  
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 08-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctors' report. Defense is challenging the report. Court called Dr. Pankiewicz and scheduled a competency hearing. lr
  Competency hearing scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua R Petrie not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.
 
Court ordered forensic  unit  to examine the defendant for competency pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.14(2).
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch  47. court ordered defendant remanded. 
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT..   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription,

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Pick N Save
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua R Petrie in court PRO SE.  
Defendant did not want to be represented by PD Attorney ( Lamke)
Defendant Joshua R Petrie in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
